committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Health, Employment, Labor, and Pensions

official_title: To provide for a credit for certain health care benefits in determining the minimum wage.

summary.text: Health Care Incentive Act - Directs the Secretary of Labor to allow any employer in interstate commerce that is required by federal or state law to pay a minimum wage rate higher than the current federal rate under the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to include the value of creditable health care benefits in determining the required wage.

titles.title: To provide for a credit for certain health care benefits in determining the minimum wage.
